item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

RSC Coder, gb2moparscape; it’s called a GUI, and it doesn’t necessarily need to use Swing.

@RIP RSC: You could’ve used the system time and formatted that to your own liking, and then used it to figure out a delta for the hour, minutes, and seconds hand, but all-in-all, pretty nice for a first.

item.title: Woohoo a clock (my first real java)
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

Well, I’m learning java now (let’s see how long I have interest in it). Well, I started with some tuts yesterday, and this is the first thing I made by myself. It’s a clock The format is better in my IDE, but the code blocks ruin it. Oh well, here it is 

public class ripprogram{
	
	public static void main(String[] args) throws InterruptedException  {
		
		int h = 0;
		int m = 0;
		int s = 0;
		
		while (s  < 61){
			System.out.println("Time: " + h + ":" + m + ":" +s);
			Thread.sleep(1000);
		s = s + 1;
		
		if (s == 60){
			m = m + 1;
			s = 0;
			
		if (m == 60){
			h = h + 1;
			m = 0;
			
		if (h == 25){
			h = 0;
		}
		}
			
		}
		}
	}
}

Read full topic
item.source: Woohoo a clock (my first real java)
